question:
Q1
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
Always to vote in elections

Q2
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
Never to try to evade taxes

Q3
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it: 
Always to obey laws and regulations

Q4 
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
To keep watch on the actions of government

Q5
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
To be active in social or political associations

Q6
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
To try to understand the reasoning of people with other opinions

Q7
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
To choose products for political, ethical or environmental reasons, even if they cost a bit more

Q8
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
To help people in [COUNTRY] who are worse off than yourself

Q9
There are different opinions as to what it takes to be a good citizen. As far as you are concerned personally on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is 
not at all important and 7 is very important, how important is it:
To help people in the rest of the world who are worse off than yourself

Q10
There are a number of groups in society. What do you think about the following groups holding public meetings? 
Should religious extremists be allowed to hold public meetings?

Q11
There are a number of groups in society. What do you think about the following groups holding public meetings? 
Should people who want to overthrow the government by force be allowed to hold public meetings?

Q12
There are a number of groups in society. What do you think about the following groups holding public meetings?
Should people prejudiced against any racial or ethnic group be allowed to hold public meetings?

Q13
Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Signed a petition

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:
Q14
Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Boycotted, or deliberately bought, certain products for political, ethical or environmental reasons

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:
Q15
Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Took part in a demonstration (any kind of demonstration)

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:
Q16
Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Attended a political meeting or rally

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:
Q17
Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Contacted, or attempted to contact, a politician or a civil servant to express your views

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:

Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Donated money or raised funds for a social or political activity

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:
Q19
Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Contacted or appeared in the media to express your views

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:
Q20
Here are some different forms of political and social action, that people can take. Please indicate, for each one, whether you have done any 
of these things in the past year, whether you have done it in the more distant past, whether you have not done it but might do it or have not 
done it and would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Expressed political views on the internet. Expression could be public or private in nature

answer.1: Have done it in the past year
answer.2: Have done it in the more distant past
answer.3: Have not done it but might do it
answer.4: Have not done it and would never do it

question:
Q21
How often do you use the media, including television, newspapers, radio and the internet, to get political news or information?

Q22
On average, about how many people do you have contact with in a typical week day, including people you live with. 
We are interested in contact on a one-to-one basis, including everyone with whom you chat, talk, or discuss matters. This can be face-to-face, by telephone, by mail, or on the internet. Please include only people you know.
Please select one from the following categories that best matches your estimate.

Q23
People sometimes belong to different kinds of groups or associations. For each type of group, please indicate whether you, belong and 
actively participate, belong but don’t actively participate, used to belong but do not any more, or have never belonged to it.
A political party

answer.3: Used to belong but do not any more

question:
Q24
People sometimes belong to different kinds of groups or associations. For each type of group, please indicate whether you, belong and 
actively participate, belong but don’t actively participate, used to belong but do not any more, or have never belonged to it.
A trade union, business, or professional association

answer.3: Used to belong but do not any more

question:
Q25
People sometimes belong to different kinds of groups or associations. For each type of group, please indicate whether you, belong and 
actively participate, belong but don’t actively participate, used to belong but do not any more, or have never belonged to it.
A church or other religious organization

answer.3: Used to belong but do not any more

question:
Q26
People sometimes belong to different kinds of groups or associations. For each type of group, please indicate whether you, belong and 
actively participate, belong but don’t actively participate, used to belong but do not any more, or have never belonged to it.
A sports, leisure or cultural group

answer.3: Used to belong but do not any more

question:
Q27
People sometimes belong to different kinds of groups or associations. For each type of group, please indicate whether you, belong and 
actively participate, belong but don’t actively participate, used to belong but do not any more, or have never belonged to it.
Another voluntary association

answer.3: Used to belong but do not any more

question:
Q28
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That all citizens have an adequate standard of living

Q29
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That government authorities respect and protect the rights of minorities

Q30
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That people be given more opportunities to participate in public decision-making

Q31
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That citizens may engage in acts of civil disobedience when they oppose government actions

Q32
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That governments respect democratic rights whatever the circumstances

Q33
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That people convicted of serious crimes lose their citizen rights

Q34
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That long-term residents of a country, who are not citizens, have the right to vote in that country's national elections

Q35
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That citizens have the right NOT to vote

Q36
There are different opinions about people's rights in a democracy. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is not at all important and 7 is very important, 
how important is it:
That health care be provided for everyone

Q37
To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
People like me don't have any say about what the government does

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q38
To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
I don't think the government cares much what people like me think

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q39
To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
I feel I have a pretty good understanding of the important political issues facing [COUNTRY].

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q40
To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
I think most people in [COUNTRY] are better informed about politics and government than I am.

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q41
Suppose a law were being considered by [appropriate national legislature] that you considered to be unjust or harmful.
If such a case arose, how likely is it that you, acting alone or together with others, would be able to try to do something about it?

Q42
If you made such an effort, how likely is it that [appropriate national legislature] would give serious attention to your demands?

PL.9: No answer incl. not applicable (code 3, 4, 8 in V45)

question:
Q43
How interested would you say you personally are in politics?

Q44
In politics people sometimes talk of left and right. Where would you place yourself on a scale from 0 to 10 where 0 means the left and 10 
means the right?

Q45
To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
Most of the time we can trust people in government to do what is right

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q46
To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
Most politicians are in politics only for what they can get out of it personally

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q47
How often do you think that people would try to take advantage of you if they got the chance, and how often would they try to be fair?

answer.1: Try to take advantage almost all of the time
answer.2: Try to take advantage most of the time
answer.3: Try to be fair most of the time
answer.4: Try to be fair almost all of the time

question:
Q48
Generally speaking, would you say that people can be trusted or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?

answer.1: People can almost always be trusted
answer.3: You usually can't be too careful in dealing with people
answer.4: You almost always can't be too careful in dealing with people

question:
Q49
When you get together with your friends, relatives or fellow workers, how often do you discuss politics?

Q50
When you hold a strong opinion about politics, how often do you try to persuade your friends, relatives or fellow workers to share your 
views?

Q51
Thinking now about politics in [COUNTRY], to what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
Political parties encourage people to become active in politics

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q52
Thinking now about politics in [COUNTRY], to what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
Political parties do not give voters real policy choices

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q53
Thinking now about politics in [COUNTRY], to what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
Referendums are a good way to decide important political questions

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question:
Q54
Thinking of the last national election in [COUNTRY], how honest was it regarding the counting and reporting of the votes?

Q55
Thinking of the last national election in [COUNTRY], how fair was it regarding the opportunities of the candidates and parties to 
campaign?

Q56
Thinking of the public service in [COUNTRY], how committed is it to serve the people?

Q57
How widespread do you think corruption is in the public service in [COUNTRY]?

answer.4: A lot of people are involved

question:
Q58
On the whole, on a scale of 0 to 10 where 0 is very poorly and 10 is very well.
How well does democracy work in [COUNTRY] today?

Q59
On the whole, on a scale of 0 to 10 where 0 is very poorly and 10 is very well.
And what about 10 years ago? How well did democracy work in [COUNTRY] then?

Q60
On the whole, on a scale of 0 to 10 where 0 is very poorly and 10 is very well.
And how about 10 years from now? How well do you think democracy will work in [COUNTRY] then?
